page.title: 06EMPLOYMENT
page.content: A random sample was taken from 235 homes. It showed the changing trends of employment over three generations, means of transport and distances travelled to work.{Mellor}is a rural area with many hill farms and grazing stock, while{Marple}has grown from a village into a thriving town. Once, mills associated with the cotton industry, and small coal mines brought people to the district, but as they declined people moved away and houses were left empty. As the roads were improved and the railways built people could travel further to work. The area then became ideal for commuters. { 95% of fathers}in the sample are {employed}leaving{5% unemployed.}The official figure for mthe area is 5.56%, well below the national average.
